metadata.atp_complexity_rationale: Two-business model (CPaaS volume-based vs SaaS subscription) with active transformation (72% revenue divestiture planned), hyperinflation accounting for Argentina subsidiary, and BRL 271M in M&A liabilities with equity conversion options create moving baseline. Requires guided interpolation with explicit revenue mix modeling.

Y0_data.Revenue_Total_unit: BRL millions, annualized from H1 2025 actual BRL 581.6M
Y0_data.Revenue_CPaaS_unit: BRL millions, 72% of total per Q2 2025 mix

Y0_data.Gross_Profit_unit: BRL millions, annualized from H1 2025 actual BRL 118.0M

Y0_data.Operating_Income_unit: BRL millions, annualized from H1 2025 actual (BRL -12.5M)
Y0_data.Net_Income_unit: BRL millions, annualized from H1 2025 actual (BRL -38.3M)
Y0_data.Total_Debt_unit: BRL millions, interest-bearing debt (current BRL 78M + non-current BRL 14.6M)
Y0_data.Acquisition_Liabilities_unit: BRL millions, earnouts primarily from Movidesk acquisition
Y0_data.Cash_unit: BRL millions, June 30, 2025 (down from BRL 117M at Dec 31, 2024)

Y0_data.Employees_unit: Count as of Dec 2024 (post 15% reduction in Q1 2025)

revenue_recognition.policy: CPaaS: Revenue recognized upon message delivery (point-in-time). SaaS: Subscription revenue recognized ratably over contract term (over-time).
revenue_recognition.notes: Standard revenue recognition; no material deviations from economic reality.

hyperinflation_accounting.policy: Argentina subsidiary subject to IAS 29 hyperinflationary accounting. Non-monetary assets/liabilities restated using general price index.
hyperinflation_accounting.notes: Impact disclosed as BRL 1.5M in H1 2025 finance costs. Immaterial to consolidated results (<1% of revenue). No adjustment needed.

intangible_amortization.policy: Goodwill not amortized (tested annually for impairment). Acquired intangibles (customer relationships, technology) amortized over 5-15 years.
intangible_amortization.notes: H1 2025 D&A of BRL 43M includes ~BRL 30-35M intangible amortization (est.). For economic analysis, treat as sunk cost from M&A. Relevant for NOPAT calculation but not future cash flow projection.

stock_based_compensation.policy: Share-based compensation expensed per IFRS 2. H1 2025: BRL 5.9M included in OpEx.
stock_based_compensation.notes: SBC is real economic cost (dilution) but non-cash. Include in EBITDA calculation but adjust for dilution in equity value calculation. Represents ~1% of revenue, relatively modest.

earnout_liabilities.policy: Acquisition earnouts recorded at fair value, adjusted for time value and performance assumptions. Changes in FV flow through P&L.
earnout_liabilities.notes: BRL 271M earnout liability (mostly Movidesk). Partial equity conversion option (BRL 100M convertible). Model as debt-like instrument with option value. If converted, reduces debt but dilutes equity. Critical for capital structure modeling.

deferred_tax_assets.policy: DTA of BRL 85.6M recognized on tax loss carryforwards, subject to realizability assessment.
deferred_tax_assets.notes: DTA represents 50% of book equity. Realizability depends on future profitability. For conservative IC calculation, exclude from operating assets. Will reduce cash taxes when profitable, but uncertain timing.

working_capital_seasonality.policy: Receivables: 65-day DSO. Payables: 73-day DPO (includes carrier payables).
working_capital_seasonality.notes: Negative CCC misleading due to high acquisition earnout installments and debt service in H1 2025. Adjust for: (1) timing of earnout payments, (2) post-divestiture reduction in carrier payables, (3) SaaS prepayments (positive WC). Model WC as % of revenue with mix shift adjustment.

market_context.Current_Stock_Price_unit: USD per share as of 2025-12-23 (web search)
market_context.FX_Rate_note: Approximate USD/BRL as of Dec 2025 (used for conversions)
market_context.Enterprise_Value_unit: USD millions (Market Cap $67M + Net Debt $50M equiv in USD)
market_context.RFR_note: US 10-Year Treasury yield ~4.5% as of Dec 2025
market_context.ERP_note: Base equity risk premium 5.0% per CVR protocol
market_context.Competitive_Position: Leading LATAM CX platform; competing with global SaaS giants (Salesforce, Zendesk) and LATAM specialists (RD Station)
market_context.Market_Sentiment: Distressed; going concern warnings, liquidity constraints, execution risk heavily discounted in valuation

share_data.FDSO_note: Fully diluted shares outstanding as of Dec 1, 2025 (28.9M Class A + 23.7M Class B per proxy filing)
share_data.Share_Class_Structure: Class A (1 vote/share) and Class B (10 votes/share)
share_data.Controlling_Shareholder: Oria Capital (PE firm via Class B shares)
share_data.Stock_Based_Compensation_Dilution: Modest ~1-2% annual dilution from equity comp
share_data.Earnout_Conversion_Dilution_Risk: BRL 100M of earnouts convertible to equity; could add 10-20% dilution if converted at current depressed share price
share_data.ATM_Program: Active; raised BRL 7.9M in H1 2025 via at-the-market equity offering

strategic_context.Current_Strategic_Cycle: Announced January 2025: Focus on scaling Zenvia Customer Cloud (SaaS), divest non-core assets (CPaaS)
strategic_context.Zenvia_Customer_Cloud_Launch: October 2024; unified AI-powered CX platform integrating marketing, sales, customer service
strategic_context.CPaaS_Divestiture_Status: Under evaluation; no transaction announced as of Dec 2025. Critical for liquidity and transformation thesis.
strategic_context.Franchise_Model: Launched Q1 2025 for SaaS distribution; 30+ franchisees in Brazil, 15% of new MRR
strategic_context.Workforce_Reduction: 15% headcount cut in Q1 2025; BRL 30-35M annual savings (net of BRL 8M severance)
strategic_context.Debt_Renegotiation_History: February 2024: Extended bank debt to Dec 2026, earnouts to Dec 2028, obtained BRL 100M equity conversion option, BRL 50M equity injection from Oria
strategic_context.Going_Concern_Assessment: Auditors flagged negative working capital (BRL -444M) and liquidity risk in Q2 2025 6-K filing
